Not only does this short live up to everything you could ask for of an Evil Dead movie, but it also sets up “Ash vs Evil Dead” fantastically.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them. Just when you think it's all clear and danger-free there is something that catches up with everyone and wants to kill everyone.
Actors: Graham Weir, Donovan Marsh

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent world. In the end, they channel their problems over into other people's families and homes during busy party moments. Their schemes can be quite devastating but meet with satisfaction from their recent wild times together.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you in and reminds me Strawberry Fields Forever and A Day in the Life by The Beatles.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy live in underground mountains (authentic UN footage). One day a female emigrant decides to travel along the road for some miles (Spanische Toledo Road--Long Island Station 56) without escort, carrying her tender three year old child born on affected ground.
